1.text: My son, attend unto my wisdom, [and] bow thine ear to my understanding:

2.text: That thou mayest regard discretion, and [that] thy lips may keep knowledge.

3.text: For the lips of a strange woman drop [as] an honeycomb, and her mouth [is] smoother than oil:

4.text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

5.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

6.text: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, [that] thou canst not know [them].

7.text: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

8.text: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

9.text: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

10.text: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours [be] in the house of a stranger;

11.text: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

12.text: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

13.text: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

14.text: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

15.text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

16.text: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, [and] rivers of waters in the streets.

17.text: Let them be only thine own, and not strangersâ€™ with thee.

18.text: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

19.text: [Let her be as] the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

20.text: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

21.text: For the ways of man [are] before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.

22.text: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

23.text: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
